title: Proverbs 1:1
content: 1 The proverbs of Solomon, the son of David, king of Israel:

title: Proverbs 1:2
content: 2 to know wisdom and instruction; to discern the words of understanding;

title: Proverbs 1:3
content: 3 to receive instruction in wise dealing, in righteousness, justice, and equity;

title: Proverbs 1:4
content: 4 to give prudence to the simple, knowledge and discretion to the young man—

title: Proverbs 1:5
content: 5 that the wise man may hear, and increase in learning; that the man of understanding may attain to sound counsel;

title: Proverbs 1:6
content: 6 to understand a proverb and parables, the words and riddles of the wise.

title: Proverbs 1:7
content: 7 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge, but the foolish despise wisdom and instruction.

title: Proverbs 1:8
content: 8 My son, listen to your father’s instruction, and don’t forsake your mother’s teaching;

title: Proverbs 1:9
content: 9 for they will be a garland to grace your head, and chains around your neck.

title: Proverbs 1:10
content: 10 My son, if sinners entice you, don’t consent.

title: Proverbs 1:11
content: 11 If they say, “Come with us. Let’s lie in wait for blood. Let’s lurk secretly for the innocent without cause.

title: Proverbs 1:12
content: 12 Let’s swallow them up alive like Sheol, and whole, like those who go down into the pit.

title: Proverbs 1:13
content: 13 We’ll find all valuable wealth. We’ll fill our houses with plunder.

title: Proverbs 1:14
content: 14 You shall cast your lot among us. We’ll all have one purse”—

title: Proverbs 1:15
content: 15 my son, don’t walk on the path with them. Keep your foot from their path,

title: Proverbs 1:16
content: 16 for their feet run to evil. They hurry to shed blood.

title: Proverbs 1:17
content: 17 For the net is spread in vain in the sight of any bird;

title: Proverbs 1:18
content: 18 but these lay in wait for their own blood. They lurk secretly for their own lives.

title: Proverbs 1:19
content: 19 So are the ways of everyone who is greedy for gain. It takes away the life of its owners.

title: Proverbs 1:20
content: 20 Wisdom calls aloud in the street. She utters her voice in the public squares.

title: Proverbs 1:21
content: 21 She calls at the head of noisy places. At the entrance of the city gates, she utters her words:

title: Proverbs 1:22
content: 22 “How long, you simple ones, will you love simplicity? How long will mockers delight themselves in mockery, and fools hate knowledge?

title: Proverbs 1:23
content: 23 Turn at my reproof. Behold, I will pour out my spirit on you. I will make known my words to you.

title: Proverbs 1:24
content: 24 Because I have called, and you have refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no one has paid attention;

title: Proverbs 1:25
content: 25 but you have ignored all my counsel, and wanted none of my reproof;

title: Proverbs 1:26
content: 26 I also will laugh at your disaster. I will mock when calamity overtakes you,

title: Proverbs 1:27
content: 27 when calamity overtakes you like a storm, when your disaster comes on like a whirlwind, when distress and anguish come on you.

title: Proverbs 1:28
content: 28 Then they will call on me, but I will not answer. They will seek me diligently, but they will not find me,

title: Proverbs 1:29
content: 29 because they hated knowledge, and didn’t choose the fear of the LORD.

title: Proverbs 1:30
content: 30 They wanted none of my counsel. They despised all my reproof.

title: Proverbs 1:31
content: 31 Therefore they will eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own schemes.

title: Proverbs 1:32
content: 32 For the backsliding of the simple will kill them. The careless ease of fools will destroy them.

title: Proverbs 1:33
content: 33 But whoever listens to me will dwell securely, and will be at ease, without fear of harm.”

title: Proverbs 2:1
content: 1 My son, if you will receive my words, and store up my commandments within you,

title: Proverbs 2:2
content: 2 so as to turn your ear to wisdom, and apply your heart to understanding;

title: Proverbs 2:3
content: 3 yes, if you call out for discernment, and lift up your voice for understanding;

title: Proverbs 2:4
content: 4 if you seek her as silver, and search for her as for hidden treasures;

title: Proverbs 2:5
content: 5 then you will understand the fear of the LORD, and find the knowledge of God.

title: Proverbs 2:6
content: 6 For the LORD gives wisdom. Out of his mouth comes knowledge and understanding.

title: Proverbs 2:7
content: 7 He lays up sound wisdom for the upright. He is a shield to those who walk in integrity,

title: Proverbs 2:8
content: 8 that he may guard the paths of justice, and preserve the way of his saints.

title: Proverbs 2:9
content: 9 Then you will understand righteousness and justice, equity and every good path.

title: Proverbs 2:10
content: 10 For wisdom will enter into your heart. Knowledge will be pleasant to your soul.

title: Proverbs 2:11
content: 11 Discretion will watch over you. Understanding will keep you,

title: Proverbs 2:12
content: 12 to deliver you from the way of evil, from the men who speak perverse things,

title: Proverbs 2:13
content: 13 who forsake the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness,

title: Proverbs 2:14
content: 14 who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the perverseness of evil,

title: Proverbs 2:15
content: 15 who are crooked in their ways, and wayward in their paths,

title: Proverbs 2:16
content: 16 to deliver you from the strange woman, even from the foreigner who flatters with her words,

title: Proverbs 2:17
content: 17 who forsakes the friend of her youth, and forgets the covenant of her God;

title: Proverbs 2:18
content: 18 for her house leads down to death, her paths to the departed spirits.

title: Proverbs 2:19
content: 19 None who go to her return again, neither do they attain to the paths of life.

title: Proverbs 2:20
content: 20 Therefore walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.

title: Proverbs 2:21
content: 21 For the upright will dwell in the land. The perfect will remain in it.

title: Proverbs 2:22
content: 22 But the wicked will be cut off from the land. The treacherous will be rooted out of it.

title: Proverbs 3:1
content: 1 My son, don’t forget my teaching, but let your heart keep my commandments,

title: Proverbs 3:2
content: 2 for they will add to you length of days, years of life, and peace.

title: Proverbs 3:3
content: 3 Don’t let kindness and truth forsake you. Bind them around your neck. Write them on the tablet of your heart.

title: Proverbs 3:4
content: 4 So you will find favor, and good understanding in the sight of God and man.

title: Proverbs 3:5
content: 5 Trust in the LORD with all your heart, and don’t lean on your own understanding.

title: Proverbs 3:6
content: 6 In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.

title: Proverbs 3:7
content: 7 Don’t be wise in your own eyes. Fear the LORD, and depart from evil.

title: Proverbs 3:8
content: 8 It will be health to your body, and nourishment to your bones.

title: Proverbs 3:9
content: 9 Honor the LORD with your substance, with the first fruits of all your increase;

title: Proverbs 3:10
content: 10 so your barns will be filled with plenty, and your vats will overflow with new wine.

title: Proverbs 3:11
content: 11 My son, don’t despise the LORD’s discipline, neither be weary of his correction;

title: Proverbs 3:12
content: 12 for whom the LORD loves, he corrects, even as a father reproves the son in whom he delights.

title: Proverbs 3:13
content: 13 Happy is the man who finds wisdom, the man who gets understanding.

title: Proverbs 3:14
content: 14 For her good profit is better than getting silver, and her return is better than fine gold.

title: Proverbs 3:15
content: 15 She is more precious than rubies. None of the things you can desire are to be compared to her.

title: Proverbs 3:16
content: 16 Length of days is in her right hand. In her left hand are riches and honor.

title: Proverbs 3:17
content: 17 Her ways are ways of pleasantness. All her paths are peace.

title: Proverbs 3:18
content: 18 She is a tree of life to those who lay hold of her. Happy is everyone who retains her.

title: Proverbs 3:19
content: 19 By wisdom the LORD founded the earth. By understanding, he established the heavens.

title: Proverbs 3:20
content: 20 By his knowledge, the depths were broken up, and the skies drop down the dew.

title: Proverbs 3:21
content: 21 My son, let them not depart from your eyes. Keep sound wisdom and discretion,

title: Proverbs 3:22
content: 22 so they will be life to your soul, and grace for your neck.

title: Proverbs 3:23
content: 23 Then you shall walk in your way securely. Your foot won’t stumble.

title: Proverbs 3:24
content: 24 When you lie down, you will not be afraid. Yes, you will lie down, and your sleep will be sweet.

title: Proverbs 3:25
content: 25 Don’t be afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it comes;

title: Proverbs 3:26
content: 26 for the LORD will be your confidence, and will keep your foot from being taken.

title: Proverbs 3:27
content: 27 Don’t withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in the power of your hand to do it.

title: Proverbs 3:28
content: 28 Don’t say to your neighbor, “Go, and come again; tomorrow I will give it to you,” when you have it by you.

title: Proverbs 3:29
content: 29 Don’t devise evil against your neighbor, since he dwells securely by you.

title: Proverbs 3:30
content: 30 Don’t strive with a man without cause, if he has done you no harm.

title: Proverbs 3:31
content: 31 Don’t envy the man of violence. Choose none of his ways.

title: Proverbs 3:32
content: 32 For the perverse is an abomination to the LORD, but his friendship is with the upright.

title: Proverbs 3:33
content: 33 The LORD’s curse is in the house of the wicked, but he blesses the habitation of the righteous.

title: Proverbs 3:34
content: 34 Surely he mocks the mockers, but he gives grace to the humble.

title: Proverbs 3:35
content: 35 The wise will inherit glory, but shame will be the promotion of fools.

title: Proverbs 4:1
content: 1 Listen, sons, to a father’s instruction. Pay attention and know understanding;

title: Proverbs 4:2
content: 2 for I give you sound learning. Don’t forsake my law.

title: Proverbs 4:3
content: 3 For I was a son to my father, tender and an only child in the sight of my mother.

title: Proverbs 4:4
content: 4 He taught me, and said to me: “Let your heart retain my words. Keep my commandments, and live.

title: Proverbs 4:5
content: 5 Get wisdom. Get understanding. Don’t forget, and don’t deviate from the words of my mouth.

title: Proverbs 4:6
content: 6 Don’t forsake her, and she will preserve you. Love her, and she will keep you.

title: Proverbs 4:7
content: 7 Wisdom is supreme. Get wisdom. Yes, though it costs all your possessions, get understanding.

title: Proverbs 4:8
content: 8 Esteem her, and she will exalt you. She will bring you to honor when you embrace her.

title: Proverbs 4:9
content: 9 She will give to your head a garland of grace. She will deliver a crown of splendor to you.”

title: Proverbs 4:10
content: 10 Listen, my son, and receive my sayings. The years of your life will be many.

title: Proverbs 4:11
content: 11 I have taught you in the way of wisdom. I have led you in straight paths.

title: Proverbs 4:12
content: 12 When you go, your steps will not be hampered. When you run, you will not stumble.

title: Proverbs 4:13
content: 13 Take firm hold of instruction. Don’t let her go. Keep her, for she is your life.

title: Proverbs 4:14
content: 14 Don’t enter into the path of the wicked. Don’t walk in the way of evil men.

title: Proverbs 4:15
content: 15 Avoid it, and don’t pass by it. Turn from it, and pass on.

title: Proverbs 4:16
content: 16 For they don’t sleep unless they do evil. Their sleep is taken away, unless they make someone fall.

title: Proverbs 4:17
content: 17 For they eat the bread of wickedness and drink the wine of violence.

title: Proverbs 4:18
content: 18 But the path of the righteous is like the dawning light that shines more and more until the perfect day.

title: Proverbs 4:19
content: 19 The way of the wicked is like darkness. They don’t know what they stumble over.

title: Proverbs 4:20
content: 20 My son, attend to my words. Turn your ear to my sayings.

title: Proverbs 4:21
content: 21 Let them not depart from your eyes. Keep them in the center of your heart.

title: Proverbs 4:22
content: 22 For they are life to those who find them, and health to their whole body.

title: Proverbs 4:23
content: 23 Keep your heart with all diligence, for out of it is the wellspring of life.

title: Proverbs 4:24
content: 24 Put away from yourself a perverse mouth. Put corrupt lips far from you.

title: Proverbs 4:25
content: 25 Let your eyes look straight ahead. Fix your gaze directly before you.

title: Proverbs 4:26
content: 26 Make the path of your feet level. Let all of your ways be established.

title: Proverbs 4:27
content: 27 Don’t turn to the right hand nor to the left. Remove your foot from evil.

title: Proverbs 5:1
content: 1 My son, pay attention to my wisdom. Turn your ear to my understanding,

title: Proverbs 5:2
content: 2 that you may maintain discretion, that your lips may preserve knowledge.

title: Proverbs 5:3
content: 3 For the lips of an adulteress drip honey. Her mouth is smoother than oil,

title: Proverbs 5:4
content: 4 but in the end she is as bitter as wormwood, and as sharp as a two-edged sword.

title: Proverbs 5:5
content: 5 Her feet go down to death. Her steps lead straight to Sheol.

title: Proverbs 5:6
content: 6 She gives no thought to the way of life. Her ways are crooked, and she doesn’t know it.

title: Proverbs 5:7
content: 7 Now therefore, my sons, listen to me. Don’t depart from the words of my mouth.

title: Proverbs 5:8
content: 8 Remove your way far from her. Don’t come near the door of her house,

title: Proverbs 5:9
content: 9 lest you give your honor to others, and your years to the cruel one;

title: Proverbs 5:10
content: 10 lest strangers feast on your wealth, and your labors enrich another man’s house.

title: Proverbs 5:11
content: 11 You will groan at your latter end, when your flesh and your body are consumed,

title: Proverbs 5:12
content: 12 and say, “How I have hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof.

title: Proverbs 5:13
content: 13 I haven’t obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor turned my ear to those who instructed me!

title: Proverbs 5:14
content: 14 I have come to the brink of utter ruin, among the gathered assembly.”

title: Proverbs 5:15
content: 15 Drink water out of your own cistern, running water out of your own well.

title: Proverbs 5:16
content: 16 Should your springs overflow in the streets, streams of water in the public squares?

title: Proverbs 5:17
content: 17 Let them be for yourself alone, not for strangers with you.

title: Proverbs 5:18
content: 18 Let your spring be blessed. Rejoice in the wife of your youth.

title: Proverbs 5:19
content: 19 A loving doe and a graceful deer— let her breasts satisfy you at all times. Be captivated always with her love.

title: Proverbs 5:20
content: 20 For why should you, my son, be captivated with an adulteress? Why embrace the bosom of another?

title: Proverbs 5:21
content: 21 For the ways of man are before the LORD’s eyes. He examines all his paths.

title: Proverbs 5:22
content: 22 The evil deeds of the wicked ensnare him. The cords of his sin hold him firmly.

title: Proverbs 5:23
content: 23 He will die for lack of instruction. In the greatness of his folly, he will go astray.

title: Proverbs 6:1
content: 1 My son, if you have become collateral for your neighbor, if you have struck your hands in pledge for a stranger,

title: Proverbs 6:2
content: 2 you are trapped by the words of your mouth; you are ensnared with the words of your mouth.

title: Proverbs 6:3
content: 3 Do this now, my son, and deliver yourself, since you have come into the hand of your neighbor. Go, humble yourself. Press your plea with your neighbor.

title: Proverbs 6:4
content: 4 Give no sleep to your eyes, nor slumber to your eyelids.

title: Proverbs 6:5
content: 5 Free yourself, like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter, like a bird from the snare of the fowler.

title: Proverbs 6:6
content: 6 Go to the ant, you sluggard. Consider her ways, and be wise;

title: Proverbs 6:7
content: 7 which having no chief, overseer, or ruler,

title: Proverbs 6:8
content: 8 provides her bread in the summer, and gathers her food in the harvest.

title: Proverbs 6:9
content: 9 How long will you sleep, sluggard? When will you arise out of your sleep?

title: Proverbs 6:10
content: 10 A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep—

title: Proverbs 6:11
content: 11 so your poverty will come as a robber, and your scarcity as an armed man.

title: Proverbs 6:12
content: 12 A worthless person, a man of iniquity, is he who walks with a perverse mouth,

title: Proverbs 6:13
content: 13 who winks with his eyes, who signals with his feet, who motions with his fingers,

title: Proverbs 6:14
content: 14 in whose heart is perverseness, who devises evil continually, who always sows discord.

title: Proverbs 6:15
content: 15 Therefore his calamity will come suddenly. He will be broken suddenly, and that without remedy.

title: Proverbs 6:16
content: 16 There are six things which the LORD hates; yes, seven which are an abomination to him:

title: Proverbs 6:17
content: 17 arrogant eyes, a lying tongue, hands that shed innocent blood,

title: Proverbs 6:18
content: 18 a heart that devises wicked schemes, feet that are swift in running to mischief,

title: Proverbs 6:19
content: 19 a false witness who utters lies, and he who sows discord among brothers.

title: Proverbs 6:20
content: 20 My son, keep your father’s commandment, and don’t forsake your mother’s teaching.

title: Proverbs 6:21
content: 21 Bind them continually on your heart. Tie them around your neck.

title: Proverbs 6:22
content: 22 When you walk, it will lead you. When you sleep, it will watch over you. When you awake, it will talk with you.

title: Proverbs 6:23
content: 23 For the commandment is a lamp, and the law is light. Reproofs of instruction are the way of life,

title: Proverbs 6:24
content: 24 to keep you from the immoral woman, from the flattery of the wayward wife’s tongue.

title: Proverbs 6:25
content: 25 Don’t lust after her beauty in your heart, neither let her captivate you with her eyelids.

title: Proverbs 6:26
content: 26 For a prostitute reduces you to a piece of bread. The adulteress hunts for your precious life.

title: Proverbs 6:27
content: 27 Can a man scoop fire into his lap, and his clothes not be burned?

title: Proverbs 6:28
content: 28 Or can one walk on hot coals, and his feet not be scorched?

title: Proverbs 6:29
content: 29 So is he who goes in to his neighbor’s wife. Whoever touches her will not be unpunished.

title: Proverbs 6:30
content: 30 Men don’t despise a thief if he steals to satisfy himself when he is hungry,

title: Proverbs 6:31
content: 31 but if he is found, he shall restore seven times. He shall give all the wealth of his house.

title: Proverbs 6:32
content: 32 He who commits adultery with a woman is void of understanding. He who does it destroys his own soul.

title: Proverbs 6:33
content: 33 He will get wounds and dishonor. His reproach will not be wiped away.

title: Proverbs 6:34
content: 34 For jealousy arouses the fury of the husband. He won’t spare in the day of vengeance.

title: Proverbs 6:35
content: 35 He won’t regard any ransom, neither will he rest content, though you give many gifts.

title: Proverbs 7:1
content: 1 My son, keep my words. Lay up my commandments within you.

title: Proverbs 7:2
content: 2 Keep my commandments and live! Guard my teaching as the apple of your eye.

title: Proverbs 7:3
content: 3 Bind them on your fingers. Write them on the tablet of your heart.

title: Proverbs 7:4
content: 4 Tell wisdom, “You are my sister.” Call understanding your relative,

title: Proverbs 7:5
content: 5 that they may keep you from the strange woman, from the foreigner who flatters with her words.

title: Proverbs 7:6
content: 6 For at the window of my house, I looked out through my lattice.

title: Proverbs 7:7
content: 7 I saw among the simple ones. I discerned among the youths a young man void of understanding,

title: Proverbs 7:8
content: 8 passing through the street near her corner, he went the way to her house,

title: Proverbs 7:9
content: 9 in the twilight, in the evening of the day, in the middle of the night and in the darkness.

title: Proverbs 7:10
content: 10 Behold, there a woman met him with the attire of a prostitute, and with crafty intent.

title: Proverbs 7:11
content: 11 She is loud and defiant. Her feet don’t stay in her house.

title: Proverbs 7:12
content: 12 Now she is in the streets, now in the squares, and lurking at every corner.

title: Proverbs 7:13
content: 13 So she caught him, and kissed him. With an impudent face she said to him:

title: Proverbs 7:14
content: 14 “Sacrifices of peace offerings are with me. Today I have paid my vows.

title: Proverbs 7:15
content: 15 Therefore I came out to meet you, to diligently seek your face, and I have found you.

title: Proverbs 7:16
content: 16 I have spread my couch with carpets of tapestry, with striped cloths of the yarn of Egypt.

title: Proverbs 7:17
content: 17 I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

title: Proverbs 7:18
content: 18 Come, let’s take our fill of loving until the morning. Let’s solace ourselves with loving.

title: Proverbs 7:19
content: 19 For my husband isn’t at home. He has gone on a long journey.

title: Proverbs 7:20
content: 20 He has taken a bag of money with him. He will come home at the full moon.”

title: Proverbs 7:21
content: 21 With persuasive words, she led him astray. With the flattering of her lips, she seduced him.

title: Proverbs 7:22
content: 22 He followed her immediately, as an ox goes to the slaughter, as a fool stepping into a noose.

title: Proverbs 7:23
content: 23 Until an arrow strikes through his liver, as a bird hurries to the snare, and doesn’t know that it will cost his life.

title: Proverbs 7:24
content: 24 Now therefore, sons, listen to me. Pay attention to the words of my mouth.

title: Proverbs 7:25
content: 25 Don’t let your heart turn to her ways. Don’t go astray in her paths,

title: Proverbs 7:26
content: 26 for she has thrown down many wounded. Yes, all her slain are a mighty army.

title: Proverbs 7:27
content: 27 Her house is the way to Sheol, going down to the rooms of death.

title: Proverbs 8:1
content: 1 Doesn’t wisdom cry out? Doesn’t understanding raise her voice?

title: Proverbs 8:2
content: 2 On the top of high places by the way, where the paths meet, she stands.

title: Proverbs 8:3
content: 3 Beside the gates, at the entry of the city, at the entry doors, she cries aloud:

title: Proverbs 8:4
content: 4 “I call to you men! I send my voice to the sons of mankind.

title: Proverbs 8:5
content: 5 You simple, understand prudence! You fools, be of an understanding heart!

title: Proverbs 8:6
content: 6 Hear, for I will speak excellent things. The opening of my lips is for right things.

title: Proverbs 8:7
content: 7 For my mouth speaks truth. Wickedness is an abomination to my lips.

title: Proverbs 8:8
content: 8 All the words of my mouth are in righteousness. There is nothing crooked or perverse in them.

title: Proverbs 8:9
content: 9 They are all plain to him who understands, right to those who find knowledge.

title: Proverbs 8:10
content: 10 Receive my instruction rather than silver, knowledge rather than choice gold.

title: Proverbs 8:11
content: 11 For wisdom is better than rubies. All the things that may be desired can’t be compared to it.

title: Proverbs 8:12
content: 12 “I, wisdom, have made prudence my dwelling. Find out knowledge and discretion.

title: Proverbs 8:13
content: 13 The fear of the LORD is to hate evil. I hate pride, arrogance, the evil way, and the perverse mouth.

title: Proverbs 8:14
content: 14 Counsel and sound knowledge are mine. I have understanding and power.

title: Proverbs 8:15
content: 15 By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.

title: Proverbs 8:16
content: 16 By me princes rule, nobles, and all the righteous rulers of the earth.

title: Proverbs 8:17
content: 17 I love those who love me. Those who seek me diligently will find me.

title: Proverbs 8:18
content: 18 With me are riches, honor, enduring wealth, and prosperity.

title: Proverbs 8:19
content: 19 My fruit is better than gold, yes, than fine gold, my yield than choice silver.

title: Proverbs 8:20
content: 20 I walk in the way of righteousness, in the middle of the paths of justice,

title: Proverbs 8:21
content: 21 that I may give wealth to those who love me. I fill their treasuries.

title: Proverbs 8:22
content: 22 “The LORD possessed me in the beginning of his work, before his deeds of old.

title: Proverbs 8:23
content: 23 I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, before the earth existed.

title: Proverbs 8:24
content: 24 When there were no depths, I was born, when there were no springs abounding with water.

title: Proverbs 8:25
content: 25 Before the mountains were settled in place, before the hills, I was born;

title: Proverbs 8:26
content: 26 while as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the beginning of the dust of the world.

title: Proverbs 8:27
content: 27 When he established the heavens, I was there. When he set a circle on the surface of the deep,

title: Proverbs 8:28
content: 28 when he established the clouds above, when the springs of the deep became strong,

title: Proverbs 8:29
content: 29 when he gave to the sea its boundary, that the waters should not violate his commandment, when he marked out the foundations of the earth,

title: Proverbs 8:30
content: 30 then I was the craftsman by his side. I was a delight day by day, always rejoicing before him,

title: Proverbs 8:31
content: 31 rejoicing in his whole world. My delight was with the sons of men.

title: Proverbs 8:32
content: 32 “Now therefore, my sons, listen to me, for blessed are those who keep my ways.

title: Proverbs 8:33
content: 33 Hear instruction, and be wise. Don’t refuse it.

title: Proverbs 8:34
content: 34 Blessed is the man who hears me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at my door posts.

title: Proverbs 8:35
content: 35 For whoever finds me finds life, and will obtain favor from the LORD.

title: Proverbs 8:36
content: 36 But he who sins against me wrongs his own soul. All those who hate me love death.”

title: Proverbs 9:1
content: 1 Wisdom has built her house. She has carved out her seven pillars.

title: Proverbs 9:2
content: 2 She has prepared her meat. She has mixed her wine. She has also set her table.

title: Proverbs 9:3
content: 3 She has sent out her maidens. She cries from the highest places of the city:

title: Proverbs 9:4
content: 4 “Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!” As for him who is void of understanding, she says to him,

title: Proverbs 9:5
content: 5 “Come, eat some of my bread, Drink some of the wine which I have mixed!

title: Proverbs 9:6
content: 6 Leave your simple ways, and live. Walk in the way of understanding.”

title: Proverbs 9:7
content: 7 One who corrects a mocker invites insult. One who reproves a wicked man invites abuse.

title: Proverbs 9:8
content: 8 Don’t reprove a scoffer, lest he hate you. Reprove a wise person, and he will love you.

title: Proverbs 9:9
content: 9 Instruct a wise person, and he will be still wiser. Teach a righteous person, and he will increase in learning.

title: Proverbs 9:10
content: 10 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom. The knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.

title: Proverbs 9:11
content: 11 For by me your days will be multiplied. The years of your life will be increased.

title: Proverbs 9:12
content: 12 If you are wise, you are wise for yourself. If you mock, you alone will bear it.

title: Proverbs 9:13
content: 13 The foolish woman is loud, undisciplined, and knows nothing.

title: Proverbs 9:14
content: 14 She sits at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,

title: Proverbs 9:15
content: 15 to call to those who pass by, who go straight on their ways,

title: Proverbs 9:16
content: 16 “Whoever is simple, let him turn in here.” As for him who is void of understanding, she says to him,

title: Proverbs 9:17
content: 17 “Stolen water is sweet. Food eaten in secret is pleasant.”

title: Proverbs 9:18
content: 18 But he doesn’t know that the departed spirits are there, that her guests are in the depths of Sheol.

title: Proverbs 10:1
content: 1 The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son makes a glad father; but a foolish son brings grief to his mother.

title: Proverbs 10:2
content: 2 Treasures of wickedness profit nothing, but righteousness delivers from death.

title: Proverbs 10:3
content: 3 The LORD will not allow the soul of the righteous to go hungry, but he thrusts away the desire of the wicked.

title: Proverbs 10:4
content: 4 He becomes poor who works with a lazy hand, but the hand of the diligent brings wealth.

title: Proverbs 10:5
content: 5 He who gathers in summer is a wise son, but he who sleeps during the harvest is a son who causes shame.

title: Proverbs 10:6
content: 6 Blessings are on the head of the righteous, but violence covers the mouth of the wicked.

title: Proverbs 10:7
content: 7 The memory of the righteous is blessed, but the name of the wicked will rot.

title: Proverbs 10:8
content: 8 The wise in heart accept commandments, but a chattering fool will fall.

title: Proverbs 10:9
content: 9 He who walks blamelessly walks surely, but he who perverts his ways will be found out.

title: Proverbs 10:10
content: 10 One who winks with the eye causes sorrow, but a chattering fool will fall.

title: Proverbs 10:11
content: 11 The mouth of the righteous is a spring of life, but violence covers the mouth of the wicked.

title: Proverbs 10:12
content: 12 Hatred stirs up strife, but love covers all wrongs.

title: Proverbs 10:13
content: 13 Wisdom is found on the lips of him who has discernment, but a rod is for the back of him who is void of understanding.

title: Proverbs 10:14
content: 14 Wise men lay up knowledge, but the mouth of the foolish is near ruin.

title: Proverbs 10:15
content: 15 The rich man’s wealth is his strong city. The destruction of the poor is their poverty.

title: Proverbs 10:16
content: 16 The labor of the righteous leads to life. The increase of the wicked leads to sin.

title: Proverbs 10:17
content: 17 He is in the way of life who heeds correction, but he who forsakes reproof leads others astray.

title: Proverbs 10:18
content: 18 He who hides hatred has lying lips. He who utters a slander is a fool.

title: Proverbs 10:19
content: 19 In the multitude of words there is no lack of disobedience, but he who restrains his lips does wisely.

title: Proverbs 10:20
content: 20 The tongue of the righteous is like choice silver. The heart of the wicked is of little worth.

title: Proverbs 10:21
content: 21 The lips of the righteous feed many, but the foolish die for lack of understanding.

title: Proverbs 10:22
content: 22 The LORD’s blessing brings wealth, and he adds no trouble to it.

title: Proverbs 10:23
content: 23 It is a fool’s pleasure to do wickedness, but wisdom is a man of understanding’s pleasure.

title: Proverbs 10:24
content: 24 What the wicked fear will overtake them, but the desire of the righteous will be granted.

title: Proverbs 10:25
content: 25 When the whirlwind passes, the wicked is no more; but the righteous stand firm forever.

title: Proverbs 10:26
content: 26 As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to those who send him.

title: Proverbs 10:27
content: 27 The fear of the LORD prolongs days, but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.

title: Proverbs 10:28
content: 28 The prospect of the righteous is joy, but the hope of the wicked will perish.

title: Proverbs 10:29
content: 29 The way of the LORD is a stronghold to the upright, but it is a destruction to the workers of iniquity.

title: Proverbs 10:30
content: 30 The righteous will never be removed, but the wicked will not dwell in the land.

title: Proverbs 10:31
content: 31 The mouth of the righteous produces wisdom, but the perverse tongue will be cut off.

title: Proverbs 10:32
content: 32 The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable, but the mouth of the wicked is perverse.

title: Proverbs 11:1
content: 1 A false balance is an abomination to the LORD, but accurate weights are his delight.

title: Proverbs 11:2
content: 2 When pride comes, then comes shame, but with humility comes wisdom.

title: Proverbs 11:3
content: 3 The integrity of the upright shall guide them, but the perverseness of the treacherous shall destroy them.

title: Proverbs 11:4
content: 4 Riches don’t profit in the day of wrath, but righteousness delivers from death.

title: Proverbs 11:5
content: 5 The righteousness of the blameless will direct his way, but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.

title: Proverbs 11:6
content: 6 The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them, but the unfaithful will be trapped by evil desires.

title: Proverbs 11:7
content: 7 When a wicked man dies, hope perishes, and expectation of power comes to nothing.

title: Proverbs 11:8
content: 8 A righteous person is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked takes his place.

title: Proverbs 11:9
content: 9 With his mouth the godless man destroys his neighbor, but the righteous will be delivered through knowledge.

title: Proverbs 11:10
content: 10 When it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices. When the wicked perish, there is shouting.

title: Proverbs 11:11
content: 11 By the blessing of the upright, the city is exalted, but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.

title: Proverbs 11:12
content: 12 One who despises his neighbor is void of wisdom, but a man of understanding holds his peace.

title: Proverbs 11:13
content: 13 One who brings gossip betrays a confidence, but one who is of a trustworthy spirit is one who keeps a secret.

title: Proverbs 11:14
content: 14 Where there is no wise guidance, the nation falls, but in the multitude of counselors there is victory.

title: Proverbs 11:15
content: 15 He who is collateral for a stranger will suffer for it, but he who refuses pledges of collateral is secure.

title: Proverbs 11:16
content: 16 A gracious woman obtains honor, but violent men obtain riches.

title: Proverbs 11:17
content: 17 The merciful man does good to his own soul, but he who is cruel troubles his own flesh.

title: Proverbs 11:18
content: 18 Wicked people earn deceitful wages, but one who sows righteousness reaps a sure reward.

title: Proverbs 11:19
content: 19 He who is truly righteous gets life. He who pursues evil gets death.

title: Proverbs 11:20
content: 20 Those who are perverse in heart are an abomination to the LORD, but those whose ways are blameless are his delight.

title: Proverbs 11:21
content: 21 Most certainly, the evil man will not be unpunished, but the offspring of the righteous will be delivered.

title: Proverbs 11:22
content: 22 Like a gold ring in a pig’s snout, is a beautiful woman who lacks discretion.

title: Proverbs 11:23
content: 23 The desire of the righteous is only good. The expectation of the wicked is wrath.

title: Proverbs 11:24
content: 24 There is one who scatters, and increases yet more. There is one who withholds more than is appropriate, but gains poverty.

title: Proverbs 11:25
content: 25 The liberal soul shall be made fat. He who waters shall be watered also himself.

title: Proverbs 11:26
content: 26 People curse someone who withholds grain, but blessing will be on the head of him who sells it.

title: Proverbs 11:27
content: 27 He who diligently seeks good seeks favor, but he who searches after evil, it shall come to him.

title: Proverbs 11:28
content: 28 He who trusts in his riches will fall, but the righteous shall flourish as the green leaf.

title: Proverbs 11:29
content: 29 He who troubles his own house shall inherit the wind. The foolish shall be servant to the wise of heart.

title: Proverbs 11:30
content: 30 The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life. He who is wise wins souls.

title: Proverbs 11:31
content: 31 Behold, the righteous shall be repaid in the earth, how much more the wicked and the sinner!

title: Proverbs 12:1
content: 1 Whoever loves correction loves knowledge, but he who hates reproof is stupid.

title: Proverbs 12:2
content: 2 A good man shall obtain favor from the LORD, but he will condemn a man of wicked plans.

title: Proverbs 12:3
content: 3 A man shall not be established by wickedness, but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.

title: Proverbs 12:4
content: 4 A worthy woman is the crown of her husband, but a disgraceful wife is as rottenness in his bones.

title: Proverbs 12:5
content: 5 The thoughts of the righteous are just, but the advice of the wicked is deceitful.

title: Proverbs 12:6
content: 6 The words of the wicked are about lying in wait for blood, but the speech of the upright rescues them.

title: Proverbs 12:7
content: 7 The wicked are overthrown, and are no more, but the house of the righteous shall stand.

title: Proverbs 12:8
content: 8 A man shall be commended according to his wisdom, but he who has a warped mind shall be despised.

title: Proverbs 12:9
content: 9 Better is he who is little known, and has a servant, than he who honors himself and lacks bread.

title: Proverbs 12:10
content: 10 A righteous man respects the life of his animal, but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.

title: Proverbs 12:11
content: 11 He who tills his land shall have plenty of bread, but he who chases fantasies is void of understanding.

title: Proverbs 12:12
content: 12 The wicked desires the plunder of evil men, but the root of the righteous flourishes.

title: Proverbs 12:13
content: 13 An evil man is trapped by sinfulness of lips, but the righteous shall come out of trouble.

title: Proverbs 12:14
content: 14 A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth. The work of a man’s hands shall be rewarded to him.

title: Proverbs 12:15
content: 15 The way of a fool is right in his own eyes, but he who is wise listens to counsel.

title: Proverbs 12:16
content: 16 A fool shows his annoyance the same day, but one who overlooks an insult is prudent.

title: Proverbs 12:17
content: 17 He who is truthful testifies honestly, but a false witness lies.

title: Proverbs 12:18
content: 18 There is one who speaks rashly like the piercing of a sword, but the tongue of the wise heals.

title: Proverbs 12:19
content: 19 Truth’s lips will be established forever, but a lying tongue is only momentary.

title: Proverbs 12:20
content: 20 Deceit is in the heart of those who plot evil, but joy comes to the promoters of peace.

title: Proverbs 12:21
content: 21 No mischief shall happen to the righteous, but the wicked shall be filled with evil.

title: Proverbs 12:22
content: 22 Lying lips are an abomination to the LORD, but those who do the truth are his delight.

title: Proverbs 12:23
content: 23 A prudent man keeps his knowledge, but the hearts of fools proclaim foolishness.

title: Proverbs 12:24
content: 24 The hands of the diligent ones shall rule, but laziness ends in slave labor.

title: Proverbs 12:25
content: 25 Anxiety in a man’s heart weighs it down, but a kind word makes it glad.

title: Proverbs 12:26
content: 26 A righteous person is cautious in friendship, but the way of the wicked leads them astray.

title: Proverbs 12:27
content: 27 The slothful man doesn’t roast his game, but the possessions of diligent men are prized.

title: Proverbs 12:28
content: 28 In the way of righteousness is life; in its path there is no death.

title: Proverbs 13:1
content: 1 A wise son listens to his father’s instruction, but a scoffer doesn’t listen to rebuke.

title: Proverbs 13:2
content: 2 By the fruit of his lips, a man enjoys good things, but the unfaithful crave violence.

title: Proverbs 13:3
content: 3 He who guards his mouth guards his soul. One who opens wide his lips comes to ruin.

title: Proverbs 13:4
content: 4 The soul of the sluggard desires, and has nothing, but the desire of the diligent shall be fully satisfied.

title: Proverbs 13:5
content: 5 A righteous man hates lies, but a wicked man brings shame and disgrace.

title: Proverbs 13:6
content: 6 Righteousness guards the way of integrity, but wickedness overthrows the sinner.

title: Proverbs 13:7
content: 7 There are some who pretend to be rich, yet have nothing. There are some who pretend to be poor, yet have great wealth.

title: Proverbs 13:8
content: 8 The ransom of a man’s life is his riches, but the poor hear no threats.

title: Proverbs 13:9
content: 9 The light of the righteous shines brightly, but the lamp of the wicked is snuffed out.

title: Proverbs 13:10
content: 10 Pride only breeds quarrels, but wisdom is with people who take advice.

title: Proverbs 13:11
content: 11 Wealth gained dishonestly dwindles away, but he who gathers by hand makes it grow.

title: Proverbs 13:12
content: 12 Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but when longing is fulfilled, it is a tree of life.

title: Proverbs 13:13
content: 13 Whoever despises instruction will pay for it, but he who respects a command will be rewarded.

title: Proverbs 13:14
content: 14 The teaching of the wise is a spring of life, to turn from the snares of death.

title: Proverbs 13:15
content: 15 Good understanding wins favor, but the way of the unfaithful is hard.

title: Proverbs 13:16
content: 16 Every prudent man acts from knowledge, but a fool exposes folly.

title: Proverbs 13:17
content: 17 A wicked messenger falls into trouble, but a trustworthy envoy gains healing.

title: Proverbs 13:18
content: 18 Poverty and shame come to him who refuses discipline, but he who heeds correction shall be honored.

title: Proverbs 13:19
content: 19 Longing fulfilled is sweet to the soul, but fools detest turning from evil.

title: Proverbs 13:20
content: 20 One who walks with wise men grows wise, but a companion of fools suffers harm.

title: Proverbs 13:21
content: 21 Misfortune pursues sinners, but prosperity rewards the righteous.

title: Proverbs 13:22
content: 22 A good man leaves an inheritance to his children’s children, but the wealth of the sinner is stored for the righteous.

title: Proverbs 13:23
content: 23 An abundance of food is in poor people’s fields, but injustice sweeps it away.

title: Proverbs 13:24
content: 24 One who spares the rod hates his son, but one who loves him is careful to discipline him.

title: Proverbs 13:25
content: 25 The righteous one eats to the satisfying of his soul, but the belly of the wicked goes hungry.

title: Proverbs 14:1
content: 1 Every wise woman builds her house, but the foolish one tears it down with her own hands.

title: Proverbs 14:2
content: 2 He who walks in his uprightness fears the LORD, but he who is perverse in his ways despises him.

title: Proverbs 14:3
content: 3 The fool’s talk brings a rod to his back, but the lips of the wise protect them.

title: Proverbs 14:4
content: 4 Where no oxen are, the crib is clean, but much increase is by the strength of the ox.

title: Proverbs 14:5
content: 5 A truthful witness will not lie, but a false witness pours out lies.

title: Proverbs 14:6
content: 6 A scoffer seeks wisdom, and doesn’t find it, but knowledge comes easily to a discerning person.

title: Proverbs 14:7
content: 7 Stay away from a foolish man, for you won’t find knowledge on his lips.

title: Proverbs 14:8
content: 8 The wisdom of the prudent is to think about his way, but the folly of fools is deceit.

title: Proverbs 14:9
content: 9 Fools mock at making atonement for sins, but among the upright there is good will.

title: Proverbs 14:10
content: 10 The heart knows its own bitterness and joy; he will not share these with a stranger.

title: Proverbs 14:11
content: 11 The house of the wicked will be overthrown, but the tent of the upright will flourish.

title: Proverbs 14:12
content: 12 There is a way which seems right to a man, but in the end it leads to death.

title: Proverbs 14:13
content: 13 Even in laughter the heart may be sorrowful, and mirth may end in heaviness.

title: Proverbs 14:14
content: 14 The unfaithful will be repaid for his own ways; likewise a good man will be rewarded for his ways.

title: Proverbs 14:15
content: 15 A simple man believes everything, but the prudent man carefully considers his ways.

title: Proverbs 14:16
content: 16 A wise man fears and shuns evil, but the fool is hot headed and reckless.

title: Proverbs 14:17
content: 17 He who is quick to become angry will commit folly, and a crafty man is hated.

title: Proverbs 14:18
content: 18 The simple inherit folly, but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

title: Proverbs 14:19
content: 19 The evil bow down before the good, and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

title: Proverbs 14:20
content: 20 The poor person is shunned even by his own neighbor, but the rich person has many friends.

title: Proverbs 14:21
content: 21 He who despises his neighbor sins, but he who has pity on the poor is blessed.

title: Proverbs 14:22
content: 22 Don’t they go astray who plot evil? But love and faithfulness belong to those who plan good.

title: Proverbs 14:23
content: 23 In all hard work there is profit, but the talk of the lips leads only to poverty.

title: Proverbs 14:24
content: 24 The crown of the wise is their riches, but the folly of fools crowns them with folly.

title: Proverbs 14:25
content: 25 A truthful witness saves souls, but a false witness is deceitful.

title: Proverbs 14:26
content: 26 In the fear of the LORD is a secure fortress, and he will be a refuge for his children.

title: Proverbs 14:27
content: 27 The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, turning people from the snares of death.

title: Proverbs 14:28
content: 28 In the multitude of people is the king’s glory, but in the lack of people is the destruction of the prince.

title: Proverbs 14:29
content: 29 He who is slow to anger has great understanding, but he who has a quick temper displays folly.

title: Proverbs 14:30
content: 30 The life of the body is a heart at peace, but envy rots the bones.

title: Proverbs 14:31
content: 31 He who oppresses the poor shows contempt for his Maker, but he who is kind to the needy honors him.

title: Proverbs 14:32
content: 32 The wicked is brought down in his calamity, but in death, the righteous has a refuge.

title: Proverbs 14:33
content: 33 Wisdom rests in the heart of one who has understanding, and is even made known in the inward part of fools.

title: Proverbs 14:34
content: 34 Righteousness exalts a nation, but sin is a disgrace to any people.

title: Proverbs 14:35
content: 35 The king’s favor is toward a servant who deals wisely, but his wrath is toward one who causes shame.

title: Proverbs 15:1
content: 1 A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.

title: Proverbs 15:2
content: 2 The tongue of the wise commends knowledge, but the mouths of fools gush out folly.

title: Proverbs 15:3
content: 3 The LORD’s eyes are everywhere, keeping watch on the evil and the good.

title: Proverbs 15:4
content: 4 A gentle tongue is a tree of life, but deceit in it crushes the spirit.

title: Proverbs 15:5
content: 5 A fool despises his father’s correction, but he who heeds reproof shows prudence.

title: Proverbs 15:6
content: 6 In the house of the righteous is much treasure, but the income of the wicked brings trouble.

title: Proverbs 15:7
content: 7 The lips of the wise spread knowledge; not so with the heart of fools.

title: Proverbs 15:8
content: 8 The sacrifice made by the wicked is an abomination to the LORD, but the prayer of the upright is his delight.

title: Proverbs 15:9
content: 9 The way of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD, but he loves him who follows after righteousness.

title: Proverbs 15:10
content: 10 There is stern discipline for one who forsakes the way. Whoever hates reproof shall die.

title: Proverbs 15:11
content: 11 Sheol and Abaddon are before the LORD— how much more then the hearts of the children of men!

title: Proverbs 15:12
content: 12 A scoffer doesn’t love to be reproved; he will not go to the wise.

title: Proverbs 15:13
content: 13 A glad heart makes a cheerful face, but an aching heart breaks the spirit.

title: Proverbs 15:14
content: 14 The heart of one who has understanding seeks knowledge, but the mouths of fools feed on folly.

title: Proverbs 15:15
content: 15 All the days of the afflicted are wretched, but one who has a cheerful heart enjoys a continual feast.

title: Proverbs 15:16
content: 16 Better is little, with the fear of the LORD, than great treasure with trouble.

title: Proverbs 15:17
content: 17 Better is a dinner of herbs, where love is, than a fattened calf with hatred.

title: Proverbs 15:18
content: 18 A wrathful man stirs up contention, but one who is slow to anger appeases strife.

title: Proverbs 15:19
content: 19 The way of the sluggard is like a thorn patch, but the path of the upright is a highway.

title: Proverbs 15:20
content: 20 A wise son makes a father glad, but a foolish man despises his mother.

title: Proverbs 15:21
content: 21 Folly is joy to one who is void of wisdom, but a man of understanding keeps his way straight.

title: Proverbs 15:22
content: 22 Where there is no counsel, plans fail; but in a multitude of counselors they are established.

title: Proverbs 15:23
content: 23 Joy comes to a man with the reply of his mouth. How good is a word at the right time!

title: Proverbs 15:24
content: 24 The path of life leads upward for the wise, to keep him from going downward to Sheol.

title: Proverbs 15:25
content: 25 The LORD will uproot the house of the proud, but he will keep the widow’s borders intact.

title: Proverbs 15:26
content: 26 The LORD detests the thoughts of the wicked, but the thoughts of the pure are pleasing.

title: Proverbs 15:27
content: 27 He who is greedy for gain troubles his own house, but he who hates bribes will live.

title: Proverbs 15:28
content: 28 The heart of the righteous weighs answers, but the mouth of the wicked gushes out evil.

title: Proverbs 15:29
content: 29 The LORD is far from the wicked, but he hears the prayer of the righteous.

title: Proverbs 15:30
content: 30 The light of the eyes rejoices the heart. Good news gives health to the bones.

title: Proverbs 15:31
content: 31 The ear that listens to reproof lives, and will be at home among the wise.

title: Proverbs 15:32
content: 32 He who refuses correction despises his own soul, but he who listens to reproof gets understanding.

title: Proverbs 15:33
content: 33 The fear of the LORD teaches wisdom. Before honor is humility.

title: Proverbs 16:1
content: 1 The plans of the heart belong to man, but the answer of the tongue is from the LORD.

title: Proverbs 16:2
content: 2 All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes, but the LORD weighs the motives.

title: Proverbs 16:3
content: 3 Commit your deeds to the LORD, and your plans shall succeed.

title: Proverbs 16:4
content: 4 The LORD has made everything for its own end— yes, even the wicked for the day of evil.

title: Proverbs 16:5
content: 5 Everyone who is proud in heart is an abomination to the LORD; they shall certainly not be unpunished.

title: Proverbs 16:6
content: 6 By mercy and truth iniquity is atoned for. By the fear of the LORD men depart from evil.

title: Proverbs 16:7
content: 7 When a man’s ways please the LORD, he makes even his enemies to be at peace with him.

title: Proverbs 16:8
content: 8 Better is a little with righteousness, than great revenues with injustice.

title: Proverbs 16:9
content: 9 A man’s heart plans his course, but the LORD directs his steps.

title: Proverbs 16:10
content: 10 Inspired judgments are on the lips of the king. He shall not betray his mouth.

title: Proverbs 16:11
content: 11 Honest balances and scales are the LORD’s; all the weights in the bag are his work.

title: Proverbs 16:12
content: 12 It is an abomination for kings to do wrong, for the throne is established by righteousness.

title: Proverbs 16:13
content: 13 Righteous lips are the delight of kings. They value one who speaks the truth.

title: Proverbs 16:14
content: 14 The king’s wrath is a messenger of death, but a wise man will pacify it.

title: Proverbs 16:15
content: 15 In the light of the king’s face is life. His favor is like a cloud of the spring rain.

title: Proverbs 16:16
content: 16 How much better it is to get wisdom than gold! Yes, to get understanding is to be chosen rather than silver.

title: Proverbs 16:17
content: 17 The highway of the upright is to depart from evil. He who keeps his way preserves his soul.

title: Proverbs 16:18
content: 18 Pride goes before destruction, and an arrogant spirit before a fall.

title: Proverbs 16:19
content: 19 It is better to be of a lowly spirit with the poor, than to divide the plunder with the proud.

title: Proverbs 16:20
content: 20 He who heeds the Word finds prosperity. Whoever trusts in the LORD is blessed.

title: Proverbs 16:21
content: 21 The wise in heart shall be called prudent. Pleasantness of the lips promotes instruction.

title: Proverbs 16:22
content: 22 Understanding is a fountain of life to one who has it, but the punishment of fools is their folly.

title: Proverbs 16:23
content: 23 The heart of the wise instructs his mouth, and adds learning to his lips.

title: Proverbs 16:24
content: 24 Pleasant words are a honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.

title: Proverbs 16:25
content: 25 There is a way which seems right to a man, but in the end it leads to death.

title: Proverbs 16:26
content: 26 The appetite of the laboring man labors for him, for his mouth urges him on.

title: Proverbs 16:27
content: 27 A worthless man devises mischief. His speech is like a scorching fire.

title: Proverbs 16:28
content: 28 A perverse man stirs up strife. A whisperer separates close friends.

title: Proverbs 16:29
content: 29 A man of violence entices his neighbor, and leads him in a way that is not good.

title: Proverbs 16:30
content: 30 One who winks his eyes to plot perversities, one who compresses his lips, is bent on evil.

title: Proverbs 16:31
content: 31 Gray hair is a crown of glory. It is attained by a life of righteousness.

title: Proverbs 16:32
content: 32 One who is slow to anger is better than the mighty; one who rules his spirit, than he who takes a city.

title: Proverbs 16:33
content: 33 The lot is cast into the lap, but its every decision is from the LORD.

title: Proverbs 17:1
content: 1 Better is a dry morsel with quietness, than a house full of feasting with strife.

title: Proverbs 17:2
content: 2 A servant who deals wisely will rule over a son who causes shame, and shall have a part in the inheritance among the brothers.

title: Proverbs 17:3
content: 3 The refining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold, but the LORD tests the hearts.

title: Proverbs 17:4
content: 4 An evildoer heeds wicked lips. A liar gives ear to a mischievous tongue.

title: Proverbs 17:5
content: 5 Whoever mocks the poor reproaches his Maker. He who is glad at calamity shall not be unpunished.

title: Proverbs 17:6
content: 6 Children’s children are the crown of old men; the glory of children is their parents.

title: Proverbs 17:7
content: 7 Excellent speech isn’t fitting for a fool, much less do lying lips fit a prince.

title: Proverbs 17:8
content: 8 A bribe is a precious stone in the eyes of him who gives it; wherever he turns, he prospers.

title: Proverbs 17:9
content: 9 He who covers an offense promotes love; but he who repeats a matter separates best friends.

title: Proverbs 17:10
content: 10 A rebuke enters deeper into one who has understanding than a hundred lashes into a fool.

title: Proverbs 17:11
content: 11 An evil man seeks only rebellion; therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.

title: Proverbs 17:12
content: 12 Let a bear robbed of her cubs meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.

title: Proverbs 17:13
content: 13 Whoever rewards evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.

title: Proverbs 17:14
content: 14 The beginning of strife is like breaching a dam, therefore stop contention before quarreling breaks out.

title: Proverbs 17:15
content: 15 He who justifies the wicked, and he who condemns the righteous, both of them alike are an abomination to the LORD.

title: Proverbs 17:16
content: 16 Why is there money in the hand of a fool to buy wisdom, since he has no understanding?

title: Proverbs 17:17
content: 17 A friend loves at all times; and a brother is born for adversity.

title: Proverbs 17:18
content: 18 A man void of understanding strikes hands, and becomes collateral in the presence of his neighbor.

title: Proverbs 17:19
content: 19 He who loves disobedience loves strife. One who builds a high gate seeks destruction.

title: Proverbs 17:20
content: 20 One who has a perverse heart doesn’t find prosperity, and one who has a deceitful tongue falls into trouble.

title: Proverbs 17:21
content: 21 He who becomes the father of a fool grieves. The father of a fool has no joy.

title: Proverbs 17:22
content: 22 A cheerful heart makes good medicine, but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.

title: Proverbs 17:23
content: 23 A wicked man receives a bribe in secret, to pervert the ways of justice.

title: Proverbs 17:24
content: 24 Wisdom is before the face of one who has understanding, but the eyes of a fool wander to the ends of the earth.

title: Proverbs 17:25
content: 25 A foolish son brings grief to his father, and bitterness to her who bore him.

title: Proverbs 17:26
content: 26 Also to punish the righteous is not good, nor to flog officials for their integrity.

title: Proverbs 17:27
content: 27 He who spares his words has knowledge. He who is even tempered is a man of understanding.

title: Proverbs 17:28
content: 28 Even a fool, when he keeps silent, is counted wise. When he shuts his lips, he is thought to be discerning.

title: Proverbs 18:1
content: 1 A man who isolates himself pursues selfishness, and defies all sound judgment.

title: Proverbs 18:2
content: 2 A fool has no delight in understanding, but only in revealing his own opinion.

title: Proverbs 18:3
content: 3 When wickedness comes, contempt also comes, and with shame comes disgrace.

title: Proverbs 18:4
content: 4 The words of a man’s mouth are like deep waters. The fountain of wisdom is like a flowing brook.

title: Proverbs 18:5
content: 5 To be partial to the faces of the wicked is not good, nor to deprive the innocent of justice.

title: Proverbs 18:6
content: 6 A fool’s lips come into strife, and his mouth invites beatings.

title: Proverbs 18:7
content: 7 A fool’s mouth is his destruction, and his lips are a snare to his soul.

title: Proverbs 18:8
content: 8 The words of a gossip are like dainty morsels: they go down into a person’s innermost parts.

title: Proverbs 18:9
content: 9 One who is slack in his work is brother to him who is a master of destruction.

title: Proverbs 18:10
content: 10 The LORD’s name is a strong tower: the righteous run to him, and are safe.

title: Proverbs 18:11
content: 11 The rich man’s wealth is his strong city, like an unscalable wall in his own imagination.

title: Proverbs 18:12
content: 12 Before destruction the heart of man is proud, but before honor is humility.

title: Proverbs 18:13
content: 13 He who answers before he hears, that is folly and shame to him.

title: Proverbs 18:14
content: 14 A man’s spirit will sustain him in sickness, but a crushed spirit, who can bear?

title: Proverbs 18:15
content: 15 The heart of the discerning gets knowledge. The ear of the wise seeks knowledge.

title: Proverbs 18:16
content: 16 A man’s gift makes room for him, and brings him before great men.

title: Proverbs 18:17
content: 17 He who pleads his cause first seems right— until another comes and questions him.

title: Proverbs 18:18
content: 18 The lot settles disputes, and keeps strong ones apart.

title: Proverbs 18:19
content: 19 A brother offended is more difficult than a fortified city. Disputes are like the bars of a fortress.

title: Proverbs 18:20
content: 20 A man’s stomach is filled with the fruit of his mouth. With the harvest of his lips he is satisfied.

title: Proverbs 18:21
content: 21 Death and life are in the power of the tongue; those who love it will eat its fruit.

title: Proverbs 18:22
content: 22 Whoever finds a wife finds a good thing, and obtains favor of the LORD.

title: Proverbs 18:23
content: 23 The poor plead for mercy, but the rich answer harshly.

title: Proverbs 18:24
content: 24 A man of many companions may be ruined, but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.

title: Proverbs 19:1
content: 1 Better is the poor who walks in his integrity than he who is perverse in his lips and is a fool.

title: Proverbs 19:2
content: 2 It isn’t good to have zeal without knowledge, nor being hasty with one’s feet and missing the way.

title: Proverbs 19:3
content: 3 The foolishness of man subverts his way; his heart rages against the LORD.

title: Proverbs 19:4
content: 4 Wealth adds many friends, but the poor is separated from his friend.

title: Proverbs 19:5
content: 5 A false witness shall not be unpunished. He who pours out lies shall not go free.

title: Proverbs 19:6
content: 6 Many will entreat the favor of a ruler, and everyone is a friend to a man who gives gifts.

title: Proverbs 19:7
content: 7 All the relatives of the poor shun him; how much more do his friends avoid him! He pursues them with pleas, but they are gone.

title: Proverbs 19:8
content: 8 He who gets wisdom loves his own soul. He who keeps understanding shall find good.

title: Proverbs 19:9
content: 9 A false witness shall not be unpunished. He who utters lies shall perish.

title: Proverbs 19:10
content: 10 Delicate living is not appropriate for a fool, much less for a servant to have rule over princes.

title: Proverbs 19:11
content: 11 The discretion of a man makes him slow to anger. It is his glory to overlook an offense.

title: Proverbs 19:12
content: 12 The king’s wrath is like the roaring of a lion, but his favor is like dew on the grass.

title: Proverbs 19:13
content: 13 A foolish son is the calamity of his father. A wife’s quarrels are a continual dripping.

title: Proverbs 19:14
content: 14 House and riches are an inheritance from fathers, but a prudent wife is from the LORD.

title: Proverbs 19:15
content: 15 Slothfulness casts into a deep sleep. The idle soul shall suffer hunger.

title: Proverbs 19:16
content: 16 He who keeps the commandment keeps his soul, but he who is contemptuous in his ways shall die.

title: Proverbs 19:17
content: 17 He who has pity on the poor lends to the LORD; he will reward him.

title: Proverbs 19:18
content: 18 Discipline your son, for there is hope; don’t be a willing party to his death.

title: Proverbs 19:19
content: 19 A hot-tempered man must pay the penalty, for if you rescue him, you must do it again.

title: Proverbs 19:20
content: 20 Listen to counsel and receive instruction, that you may be wise in your latter end.

title: Proverbs 19:21
content: 21 There are many plans in a man’s heart, but the LORD’s counsel will prevail.

title: Proverbs 19:22
content: 22 That which makes a man to be desired is his kindness. A poor man is better than a liar.

title: Proverbs 19:23
content: 23 The fear of the LORD leads to life, then contentment; he rests and will not be touched by trouble.

title: Proverbs 19:24
content: 24 The sluggard buries his hand in the dish; he will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.

title: Proverbs 19:25
content: 25 Flog a scoffer, and the simple will learn prudence; rebuke one who has understanding, and he will gain knowledge.

title: Proverbs 19:26
content: 26 He who robs his father and drives away his mother is a son who causes shame and brings reproach.

title: Proverbs 19:27
content: 27 If you stop listening to instruction, my son, you will stray from the words of knowledge.

title: Proverbs 19:28
content: 28 A corrupt witness mocks justice, and the mouth of the wicked gulps down iniquity.

title: Proverbs 19:29
content: 29 Penalties are prepared for scoffers, and beatings for the backs of fools.

title: Proverbs 20:1
content: 1 Wine is a mocker and beer is a brawler. Whoever is led astray by them is not wise.

title: Proverbs 20:2
content: 2 The terror of a king is like the roaring of a lion. He who provokes him to anger forfeits his own life.

title: Proverbs 20:3
content: 3 It is an honor for a man to keep aloof from strife, but every fool will be quarreling.

title: Proverbs 20:4
content: 4 The sluggard will not plow by reason of the winter; therefore he shall beg in harvest, and have nothing.

title: Proverbs 20:5
content: 5 Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water, but a man of understanding will draw it out.

title: Proverbs 20:6
content: 6 Many men claim to be men of unfailing love, but who can find a faithful man?

title: Proverbs 20:7
content: 7 A righteous man walks in integrity. Blessed are his children after him.

title: Proverbs 20:8
content: 8 A king who sits on the throne of judgment scatters away all evil with his eyes.

title: Proverbs 20:9
content: 9 Who can say, “I have made my heart pure. I am clean and without sin”?

title: Proverbs 20:10
content: 10 Differing weights and differing measures, both of them alike are an abomination to the LORD.

title: Proverbs 20:11
content: 11 Even a child makes himself known by his doings, whether his work is pure, and whether it is right.

title: Proverbs 20:12
content: 12 The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, the LORD has made even both of them.

title: Proverbs 20:13
content: 13 Don’t love sleep, lest you come to poverty. Open your eyes, and you shall be satisfied with bread.

title: Proverbs 20:14
content: 14 “It’s no good, it’s no good,” says the buyer; but when he is gone his way, then he boasts.

title: Proverbs 20:15
content: 15 There is gold and abundance of rubies, but the lips of knowledge are a rare jewel.

title: Proverbs 20:16
content: 16 Take the garment of one who puts up collateral for a stranger; and hold him in pledge for a wayward woman.

title: Proverbs 20:17
content: 17 Fraudulent food is sweet to a man, but afterwards his mouth is filled with gravel.

title: Proverbs 20:18
content: 18 Plans are established by advice; by wise guidance you wage war!

title: Proverbs 20:19
content: 19 He who goes about as a tale-bearer reveals secrets; therefore don’t keep company with him who opens wide his lips.

title: Proverbs 20:20
content: 20 Whoever curses his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in blackness of darkness.

title: Proverbs 20:21
content: 21 An inheritance quickly gained at the beginning won’t be blessed in the end.

title: Proverbs 20:22
content: 22 Don’t say, “I will pay back evil.” Wait for the LORD, and he will save you.

title: Proverbs 20:23
content: 23 The LORD detests differing weights, and dishonest scales are not pleasing.

title: Proverbs 20:24
content: 24 A man’s steps are from the LORD; how then can man understand his way?

title: Proverbs 20:25
content: 25 It is a snare to a man to make a rash dedication, then later to consider his vows.

title: Proverbs 20:26
content: 26 A wise king winnows out the wicked, and drives the threshing wheel over them.

title: Proverbs 20:27
content: 27 The spirit of man is the LORD’s lamp, searching all his innermost parts.

title: Proverbs 20:28
content: 28 Love and faithfulness keep the king safe. His throne is sustained by love.

title: Proverbs 20:29
content: 29 The glory of young men is their strength. The splendor of old men is their gray hair.

title: Proverbs 20:30
content: 30 Wounding blows cleanse away evil, and beatings purge the innermost parts.

title: Proverbs 21:1
content: 1 The king’s heart is in the LORD’s hand like the watercourses. He turns it wherever he desires.

title: Proverbs 21:2
content: 2 Every way of a man is right in his own eyes, but the LORD weighs the hearts.

title: Proverbs 21:3
content: 3 To do righteousness and justice is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.

title: Proverbs 21:4
content: 4 A high look and a proud heart, the lamp of the wicked, is sin.

title: Proverbs 21:5
content: 5 The plans of the diligent surely lead to profit; and everyone who is hasty surely rushes to poverty.

title: Proverbs 21:6
content: 6 Getting treasures by a lying tongue is a fleeting vapor for those who seek death.

title: Proverbs 21:7
content: 7 The violence of the wicked will drive them away, because they refuse to do what is right.

title: Proverbs 21:8
content: 8 The way of the guilty is devious, but the conduct of the innocent is upright.

title: Proverbs 21:9
content: 9 It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop than to share a house with a contentious woman.

title: Proverbs 21:10
content: 10 The soul of the wicked desires evil; his neighbor finds no mercy in his eyes.

title: Proverbs 21:11
content: 11 When the mocker is punished, the simple gains wisdom. When the wise is instructed, he receives knowledge.

title: Proverbs 21:12
content: 12 The Righteous One considers the house of the wicked, and brings the wicked to ruin.

title: Proverbs 21:13
content: 13 Whoever stops his ears at the cry of the poor, he will also cry out, but shall not be heard.

title: Proverbs 21:14
content: 14 A gift in secret pacifies anger, and a bribe in the cloak, strong wrath.

title: Proverbs 21:15
content: 15 It is joy to the righteous to do justice; but it is a destruction to the workers of iniquity.

title: Proverbs 21:16
content: 16 The man who wanders out of the way of understanding shall rest in the assembly of the departed spirits.

title: Proverbs 21:17
content: 17 He who loves pleasure will be a poor man. He who loves wine and oil won’t be rich.

title: Proverbs 21:18
content: 18 The wicked is a ransom for the righteous, the treacherous for the upright.

title: Proverbs 21:19
content: 19 It is better to dwell in a desert land, than with a contentious and fretful woman.

title: Proverbs 21:20
content: 20 There is precious treasure and oil in the dwelling of the wise, but a foolish man swallows it up.

title: Proverbs 21:21
content: 21 He who follows after righteousness and kindness finds life, righteousness, and honor.

title: Proverbs 21:22
content: 22 A wise man scales the city of the mighty, and brings down the strength of its confidence.

title: Proverbs 21:23
content: 23 Whoever guards his mouth and his tongue keeps his soul from troubles.

title: Proverbs 21:24
content: 24 The proud and arrogant man—“Scoffer” is his name— he works in the arrogance of pride.

title: Proverbs 21:25
content: 25 The desire of the sluggard kills him, for his hands refuse to labor.

title: Proverbs 21:26
content: 26 There are those who covet greedily all day long; but the righteous give and don’t withhold.

title: Proverbs 21:27
content: 27 The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination— how much more, when he brings it with a wicked mind!

title: Proverbs 21:28
content: 28 A false witness will perish. A man who listens speaks to eternity.

title: Proverbs 21:29
content: 29 A wicked man hardens his face; but as for the upright, he establishes his ways.

title: Proverbs 21:30
content: 30 There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the LORD.

title: Proverbs 21:31
content: 31 The horse is prepared for the day of battle; but victory is with the LORD.

title: Proverbs 22:1
content: 1 A good name is more desirable than great riches, and loving favor is better than silver and gold.

title: Proverbs 22:2
content: 2 The rich and the poor have this in common: The LORD is the maker of them all.

title: Proverbs 22:3
content: 3 A prudent man sees danger and hides himself; but the simple pass on, and suffer for it.

title: Proverbs 22:4
content: 4 The result of humility and the fear of the LORD is wealth, honor, and life.

title: Proverbs 22:5
content: 5 Thorns and snares are in the path of the wicked; whoever guards his soul stays far from them.

title: Proverbs 22:6
content: 6 Train up a child in the way he should go, and when he is old he will not depart from it.

title: Proverbs 22:7
content: 7 The rich rule over the poor. The borrower is servant to the lender.

title: Proverbs 22:8
content: 8 He who sows wickedness reaps trouble, and the rod of his fury will be destroyed.

title: Proverbs 22:9
content: 9 He who has a generous eye will be blessed, for he shares his food with the poor.

title: Proverbs 22:10
content: 10 Drive out the mocker, and strife will go out; yes, quarrels and insults will stop.

title: Proverbs 22:11
content: 11 He who loves purity of heart and speaks gracefully is the king’s friend.

title: Proverbs 22:12
content: 12 The LORD’s eyes watch over knowledge, but he frustrates the words of the unfaithful.

title: Proverbs 22:13
content: 13 The sluggard says, “There is a lion outside! I will be killed in the streets!”

title: Proverbs 22:14
content: 14 The mouth of an adulteress is a deep pit. He who is under the LORD’s wrath will fall into it.

title: Proverbs 22:15
content: 15 Folly is bound up in the heart of a child; the rod of discipline drives it far from him.

title: Proverbs 22:16
content: 16 Whoever oppresses the poor for his own increase and whoever gives to the rich, both come to poverty.

title: Proverbs 22:17
content: 17 Turn your ear, and listen to the words of the wise. Apply your heart to my teaching.

title: Proverbs 22:18
content: 18 For it is a pleasant thing if you keep them within you, if all of them are ready on your lips.

title: Proverbs 22:19
content: 19 I teach you today, even you, so that your trust may be in the LORD.

title: Proverbs 22:20
content: 20 Haven’t I written to you thirty excellent things of counsel and knowledge,

title: Proverbs 22:21
content: 21 To teach you truth, reliable words, to give sound answers to the ones who sent you?

title: Proverbs 22:22
content: 22 Don’t exploit the poor because he is poor; and don’t crush the needy in court;

title: Proverbs 22:23
content: 23 for the LORD will plead their case, and plunder the life of those who plunder them.

title: Proverbs 22:24
content: 24 Don’t befriend a hot-tempered man. Don’t associate with one who harbors anger,

title: Proverbs 22:25
content: 25 lest you learn his ways and ensnare your soul.

title: Proverbs 22:26
content: 26 Don’t you be one of those who strike hands, of those who are collateral for debts.

title: Proverbs 22:27
content: 27 If you don’t have means to pay, why should he take away your bed from under you?

title: Proverbs 22:28
content: 28 Don’t move the ancient boundary stone which your fathers have set up.

title: Proverbs 22:29
content: 29 Do you see a man skilled in his work? He will serve kings. He won’t serve obscure men.

title: Proverbs 23:1
content: 1 When you sit to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before you;

title: Proverbs 23:2
content: 2 put a knife to your throat if you are a man given to appetite.

title: Proverbs 23:3
content: 3 Don’t be desirous of his dainties, since they are deceitful food.

title: Proverbs 23:4
content: 4 Don’t weary yourself to be rich. In your wisdom, show restraint.

title: Proverbs 23:5
content: 5 Why do you set your eyes on that which is not? For it certainly sprouts wings like an eagle and flies in the sky.

title: Proverbs 23:6
content: 6 Don’t eat the food of him who has a stingy eye, and don’t crave his delicacies,

title: Proverbs 23:7
content: 7 for as he thinks about the cost, so he is. “Eat and drink!” he says to you, but his heart is not with you.

title: Proverbs 23:8
content: 8 You will vomit up the morsel which you have eaten and waste your pleasant words.

title: Proverbs 23:9
content: 9 Don’t speak in the ears of a fool, for he will despise the wisdom of your words.

title: Proverbs 23:10
content: 10 Don’t move the ancient boundary stone. Don’t encroach on the fields of the fatherless,

title: Proverbs 23:11
content: 11 for their Defender is strong. He will plead their case against you.

title: Proverbs 23:12
content: 12 Apply your heart to instruction, and your ears to the words of knowledge.

title: Proverbs 23:13
content: 13 Don’t withhold correction from a child. If you punish him with the rod, he will not die.

title: Proverbs 23:14
content: 14 Punish him with the rod, and save his soul from Sheol.

title: Proverbs 23:15
content: 15 My son, if your heart is wise, then my heart will be glad, even mine.

title: Proverbs 23:16
content: 16 Yes, my heart will rejoice when your lips speak what is right.

title: Proverbs 23:17
content: 17 Don’t let your heart envy sinners, but rather fear the LORD all day long.

title: Proverbs 23:18
content: 18 Indeed surely there is a future hope, and your hope will not be cut off.

title: Proverbs 23:19
content: 19 Listen, my son, and be wise, and keep your heart on the right path!

title: Proverbs 23:20
content: 20 Don’t be among ones drinking too much wine, or those who gorge themselves on meat;

title: Proverbs 23:21
content: 21 for the drunkard and the glutton shall become poor; and drowsiness clothes them in rags.

title: Proverbs 23:22
content: 22 Listen to your father who gave you life, and don’t despise your mother when she is old.

title: Proverbs 23:23
content: 23 Buy the truth, and don’t sell it. Get wisdom, discipline, and understanding.

title: Proverbs 23:24
content: 24 The father of the righteous has great joy. Whoever fathers a wise child delights in him.

title: Proverbs 23:25
content: 25 Let your father and your mother be glad! Let her who bore you rejoice!

title: Proverbs 23:26
content: 26 My son, give me your heart; and let your eyes keep in my ways.

title: Proverbs 23:27
content: 27 For a prostitute is a deep pit; and a wayward wife is a narrow well.

title: Proverbs 23:28
content: 28 Yes, she lies in wait like a robber, and increases the unfaithful among men.

title: Proverbs 23:29
content: 29 Who has woe? Who has sorrow? Who has strife? Who has complaints? Who has needless bruises? Who has bloodshot eyes?

title: Proverbs 23:30
content: 30 Those who stay long at the wine; those who go to seek out mixed wine.

title: Proverbs 23:31
content: 31 Don’t look at the wine when it is red, when it sparkles in the cup, when it goes down smoothly.

title: Proverbs 23:32
content: 32 In the end, it bites like a snake, and poisons like a viper.

title: Proverbs 23:33
content: 33 Your eyes will see strange things, and your mind will imagine confusing things.

title: Proverbs 23:34
content: 34 Yes, you will be as he who lies down in the middle of the sea, or as he who lies on top of the rigging:

title: Proverbs 23:35
content: 35 “They hit me, and I was not hurt! They beat me, and I don’t feel it! When will I wake up? I can do it again. I will look for more.”

title: Proverbs 24:1
content: 1 Don’t be envious of evil men, neither desire to be with them;

title: Proverbs 24:2
content: 2 for their hearts plot violence and their lips talk about mischief.

title: Proverbs 24:3
content: 3 Through wisdom a house is built; by understanding it is established;

title: Proverbs 24:4
