content: 4 by knowledge the rooms are filled with all rare and beautiful treasure.

title: Proverbs 24:5
content: 5 A wise man has great power. A knowledgeable man increases strength,

title: Proverbs 24:6
content: 6 for by wise guidance you wage your war, and victory is in many advisors.

title: Proverbs 24:7
content: 7 Wisdom is too high for a fool. He doesn’t open his mouth in the gate.

title: Proverbs 24:8
content: 8 One who plots to do evil will be called a schemer.

title: Proverbs 24:9
content: 9 The schemes of folly are sin. The mocker is detested by men.

title: Proverbs 24:10
content: 10 If you falter in the time of trouble, your strength is small.

title: Proverbs 24:11
content: 11 Rescue those who are being led away to death! Indeed, hold back those who are staggering to the slaughter!

title: Proverbs 24:12
content: 12 If you say, “Behold, we didn’t know this,” doesn’t he who weighs the hearts consider it? He who keeps your soul, doesn’t he know it? Shall he not render to every man according to his work?

title: Proverbs 24:13
content: 13 My son, eat honey, for it is good, the droppings of the honeycomb, which are sweet to your taste;

title: Proverbs 24:14
content: 14 so you shall know wisdom to be to your soul. If you have found it, then there will be a reward: Your hope will not be cut off.

title: Proverbs 24:15
content: 15 Don’t lay in wait, wicked man, against the habitation of the righteous. Don’t destroy his resting place;

title: Proverbs 24:16
content: 16 for a righteous man falls seven times and rises up again, but the wicked are overthrown by calamity.

title: Proverbs 24:17
content: 17 Don’t rejoice when your enemy falls. Don’t let your heart be glad when he is overthrown,

title: Proverbs 24:18
content: 18 lest the LORD see it, and it displease him, and he turn away his wrath from him.

title: Proverbs 24:19
content: 19 Don’t fret yourself because of evildoers, neither be envious of the wicked;

title: Proverbs 24:20
content: 20 for there will be no reward to the evil man. The lamp of the wicked will be snuffed out.

title: Proverbs 24:21
content: 21 My son, fear the LORD and the king. Don’t join those who are rebellious,

title: Proverbs 24:22
content: 22 for their calamity will rise suddenly. Who knows what destruction may come from them both?

title: Proverbs 24:23
content: 23 These also are sayings of the wise: To show partiality in judgment is not good.

title: Proverbs 24:24
content: 24 He who says to the wicked, “You are righteous,” peoples will curse him, and nations will abhor him—

title: Proverbs 24:25
content: 25 but it will go well with those who convict the guilty, and a rich blessing will come on them.

title: Proverbs 24:26
content: 26 An honest answer is like a kiss on the lips.

title: Proverbs 24:27
content: 27 Prepare your work outside, and get your fields ready. Afterwards, build your house.

title: Proverbs 24:28
content: 28 Don’t be a witness against your neighbor without cause. Don’t deceive with your lips.

title: Proverbs 24:29
content: 29 Don’t say, “I will do to him as he has done to me; I will repay the man according to his work.”

title: Proverbs 24:30
content: 30 I went by the field of the sluggard, by the vineyard of the man void of understanding.

title: Proverbs 24:31
content: 31 Behold, it was all grown over with thorns. Its surface was covered with nettles, and its stone wall was broken down.

title: Proverbs 24:32
content: 32 Then I saw, and considered well. I saw, and received instruction:

title: Proverbs 24:33
content: 33 a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep,

title: Proverbs 24:34
content: 34 so your poverty will come as a robber and your want as an armed man.

title: Proverbs 25:1
content: 1 These also are proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.

title: Proverbs 25:2
content: 2 It is the glory of God to conceal a thing, but the glory of kings is to search out a matter.

title: Proverbs 25:3
content: 3 As the heavens for height, and the earth for depth, so the hearts of kings are unsearchable.

title: Proverbs 25:4
content: 4 Take away the dross from the silver, and material comes out for the refiner.

title: Proverbs 25:5
content: 5 Take away the wicked from the king’s presence, and his throne will be established in righteousness.

title: Proverbs 25:6
content: 6 Don’t exalt yourself in the presence of the king, or claim a place among great men;

title: Proverbs 25:7
content: 7 for it is better that it be said to you, “Come up here,” than that you should be put lower in the presence of the prince, whom your eyes have seen.

title: Proverbs 25:8
content: 8 Don’t be hasty in bringing charges to court. What will you do in the end when your neighbor shames you?

title: Proverbs 25:9
content: 9 Debate your case with your neighbor, and don’t betray the confidence of another,

title: Proverbs 25:10
content: 10 lest one who hears it put you to shame, and your bad reputation never depart.

title: Proverbs 25:11
content: 11 A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in settings of silver.

title: Proverbs 25:12
content: 12 As an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, so is a wise reprover to an obedient ear.

title: Proverbs 25:13
content: 13 As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to those who send him; for he refreshes the soul of his masters.

title: Proverbs 25:14
content: 14 As clouds and wind without rain, so is he who boasts of gifts deceptively.

title: Proverbs 25:15
content: 15 By patience a ruler is persuaded. A soft tongue breaks the bone.

title: Proverbs 25:16
content: 16 Have you found honey? Eat as much as is sufficient for you, lest you eat too much, and vomit it.

title: Proverbs 25:17
content: 17 Let your foot be seldom in your neighbor’s house, lest he be weary of you, and hate you.

title: Proverbs 25:18
content: 18 A man who gives false testimony against his neighbor is like a club, a sword, or a sharp arrow.

title: Proverbs 25:19
content: 19 Confidence in someone unfaithful in time of trouble is like a bad tooth or a lame foot.

title: Proverbs 25:20
content: 20 As one who takes away a garment in cold weather, or vinegar on soda, so is one who sings songs to a heavy heart.

title: Proverbs 25:21
content: 21 If your enemy is hungry, give him food to eat. If he is thirsty, give him water to drink;

title: Proverbs 25:22
content: 22 for you will heap coals of fire on his head, and the LORD will reward you.

title: Proverbs 25:23
content: 23 The north wind produces rain; so a backbiting tongue brings an angry face.

title: Proverbs 25:24
content: 24 It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop than to share a house with a contentious woman.

title: Proverbs 25:25
content: 25 Like cold water to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.

title: Proverbs 25:26
content: 26 Like a muddied spring and a polluted well, so is a righteous man who gives way before the wicked.

title: Proverbs 25:27
content: 27 It is not good to eat much honey, nor is it honorable to seek one’s own honor.

title: Proverbs 25:28
content: 28 Like a city that is broken down and without walls is a man whose spirit is without restraint.

title: Proverbs 26:1
content: 1 Like snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honor is not fitting for a fool.

title: Proverbs 26:2
content: 2 Like a fluttering sparrow, like a darting swallow, so the undeserved curse doesn’t come to rest.

title: Proverbs 26:3
content: 3 A whip is for the horse, a bridle for the donkey, and a rod for the back of fools!

title: Proverbs 26:4
content: 4 Don’t answer a fool according to his folly, lest you also be like him.

title: Proverbs 26:5
content: 5 Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own eyes.

title: Proverbs 26:6
content: 6 One who sends a message by the hand of a fool is cutting off feet and drinking violence.

title: Proverbs 26:7
content: 7 Like the legs of the lame that hang loose, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

title: Proverbs 26:8
content: 8 As one who binds a stone in a sling, so is he who gives honor to a fool.

title: Proverbs 26:9
content: 9 Like a thorn bush that goes into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

title: Proverbs 26:10
content: 10 As an archer who wounds all, so is he who hires a fool or he who hires those who pass by.

title: Proverbs 26:11
content: 11 As a dog that returns to his vomit, so is a fool who repeats his folly.

title: Proverbs 26:12
content: 12 Do you see a man wise in his own eyes? There is more hope for a fool than for him.

title: Proverbs 26:13
content: 13 The sluggard says, “There is a lion in the road! A fierce lion roams the streets!”

title: Proverbs 26:14
content: 14 As the door turns on its hinges, so does the sluggard on his bed.

title: Proverbs 26:15
content: 15 The sluggard buries his hand in the dish. He is too lazy to bring it back to his mouth.

title: Proverbs 26:16
content: 16 The sluggard is wiser in his own eyes than seven men who answer with discretion.

title: Proverbs 26:17
content: 17 Like one who grabs a dog’s ears is one who passes by and meddles in a quarrel not his own.

title: Proverbs 26:18
content: 18 Like a madman who shoots torches, arrows, and death,

title: Proverbs 26:19
content: 19 is the man who deceives his neighbor and says, “Am I not joking?”

title: Proverbs 26:20
content: 20 For lack of wood a fire goes out. Without gossip, a quarrel dies down.

title: Proverbs 26:21
content: 21 As coals are to hot embers, and wood to fire, so is a contentious man to kindling strife.

title: Proverbs 26:22
content: 22 The words of a whisperer are as dainty morsels, they go down into the innermost parts.

title: Proverbs 26:23
content: 23 Like silver dross on an earthen vessel are the lips of a fervent one with an evil heart.

title: Proverbs 26:24
content: 24 A malicious man disguises himself with his lips, but he harbors evil in his heart.

title: Proverbs 26:25
content: 25 When his speech is charming, don’t believe him, for there are seven abominations in his heart.

title: Proverbs 26:26
content: 26 His malice may be concealed by deception, but his wickedness will be exposed in the assembly.

title: Proverbs 26:27
content: 27 Whoever digs a pit shall fall into it. Whoever rolls a stone, it will come back on him.

title: Proverbs 26:28
content: 28 A lying tongue hates those it hurts; and a flattering mouth works ruin.

title: Proverbs 27:1
content: 1 Don’t boast about tomorrow; for you don’t know what a day may bring.

title: Proverbs 27:2
content: 2 Let another man praise you, and not your own mouth; a stranger, and not your own lips.

title: Proverbs 27:3
content: 3 A stone is heavy, and sand is a burden; but a fool’s provocation is heavier than both.

title: Proverbs 27:4
content: 4 Wrath is cruel, and anger is overwhelming; but who is able to stand before jealousy?

title: Proverbs 27:5
content: 5 Better is open rebuke than hidden love.

title: Proverbs 27:6
content: 6 The wounds of a friend are faithful, although the kisses of an enemy are profuse.

title: Proverbs 27:7
content: 7 A full soul loathes a honeycomb; but to a hungry soul, every bitter thing is sweet.

title: Proverbs 27:8
content: 8 As a bird that wanders from her nest, so is a man who wanders from his home.

title: Proverbs 27:9
content: 9 Perfume and incense bring joy to the heart; so does earnest counsel from a man’s friend.

title: Proverbs 27:10
content: 10 Don’t forsake your friend and your father’s friend. Don’t go to your brother’s house in the day of your disaster. A neighbor who is near is better than a distant brother.

title: Proverbs 27:11
content: 11 Be wise, my son, and bring joy to my heart, then I can answer my tormentor.

title: Proverbs 27:12
content: 12 A prudent man sees danger and takes refuge; but the simple pass on, and suffer for it.

title: Proverbs 27:13
content: 13 Take his garment when he puts up collateral for a stranger. Hold it for a wayward woman!

title: Proverbs 27:14
content: 14 He who blesses his neighbor with a loud voice early in the morning, it will be taken as a curse by him.

title: Proverbs 27:15
content: 15 A continual dropping on a rainy day and a contentious wife are alike:

title: Proverbs 27:16
content: 16 restraining her is like restraining the wind, or like grasping oil in his right hand.

title: Proverbs 27:17
content: 17 Iron sharpens iron; so a man sharpens his friend’s countenance.

title: Proverbs 27:18
content: 18 Whoever tends the fig tree shall eat its fruit. He who looks after his master shall be honored.

title: Proverbs 27:19
content: 19 Like water reflects a face, so a man’s heart reflects the man.

title: Proverbs 27:20
content: 20 Sheol and Abaddon are never satisfied; and a man’s eyes are never satisfied.

title: Proverbs 27:21
content: 21 The crucible is for silver, and the furnace for gold; but man is refined by his praise.

title: Proverbs 27:22
content: 22 Though you grind a fool in a mortar with a pestle along with grain, yet his foolishness will not be removed from him.

title: Proverbs 27:23
content: 23 Know well the state of your flocks, and pay attention to your herds,

title: Proverbs 27:24
content: 24 for riches are not forever, nor does the crown endure to all generations.

title: Proverbs 27:25
content: 25 The hay is removed, and the new growth appears, the grasses of the hills are gathered in.

title: Proverbs 27:26
content: 26 The lambs are for your clothing, and the goats are the price of a field.

title: Proverbs 27:27
content: 27 There will be plenty of goats’ milk for your food, for your family’s food, and for the nourishment of your servant girls.

title: Proverbs 28:1
content: 1 The wicked flee when no one pursues; but the righteous are as bold as a lion.

title: Proverbs 28:2
content: 2 In rebellion, a land has many rulers, but order is maintained by a man of understanding and knowledge.

title: Proverbs 28:3
content: 3 A needy man who oppresses the poor is like a driving rain which leaves no crops.

title: Proverbs 28:4
content: 4 Those who forsake the law praise the wicked; but those who keep the law contend with them.

title: Proverbs 28:5
content: 5 Evil men don’t understand justice; but those who seek the LORD understand it fully.

title: Proverbs 28:6
content: 6 Better is the poor who walks in his integrity than he who is perverse in his ways, and he is rich.

title: Proverbs 28:7
content: 7 Whoever keeps the law is a wise son; but he who is a companion of gluttons shames his father.

title: Proverbs 28:8
content: 8 He who increases his wealth by excessive interest gathers it for one who has pity on the poor.

title: Proverbs 28:9
content: 9 He who turns away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer is an abomination.

title: Proverbs 28:10
content: 10 Whoever causes the upright to go astray in an evil way, he will fall into his own trap; but the blameless will inherit good.

title: Proverbs 28:11
content: 11 The rich man is wise in his own eyes; but the poor who has understanding sees through him.

title: Proverbs 28:12
content: 12 When the righteous triumph, there is great glory; but when the wicked rise, men hide themselves.

title: Proverbs 28:13
content: 13 He who conceals his sins doesn’t prosper, but whoever confesses and renounces them finds mercy.

title: Proverbs 28:14
content: 14 Blessed is the man who always fears; but one who hardens his heart falls into trouble.

title: Proverbs 28:15
content: 15 As a roaring lion or a charging bear, so is a wicked ruler over helpless people.

title: Proverbs 28:16
content: 16 A tyrannical ruler lacks judgment. One who hates ill-gotten gain will have long days.

title: Proverbs 28:17
content: 17 A man who is tormented by blood guilt will be a fugitive until death. No one will support him.

title: Proverbs 28:18
content: 18 Whoever walks blamelessly is kept safe; but one with perverse ways will fall suddenly.

title: Proverbs 28:19
content: 19 One who works his land will have an abundance of food; but one who chases fantasies will have his fill of poverty.

title: Proverbs 28:20
content: 20 A faithful man is rich with blessings; but one who is eager to be rich will not go unpunished.

title: Proverbs 28:21
content: 21 To show partiality is not good, yet a man will do wrong for a piece of bread.

title: Proverbs 28:22
content: 22 A stingy man hurries after riches, and doesn’t know that poverty waits for him.

title: Proverbs 28:23
content: 23 One who rebukes a man will afterward find more favor than one who flatters with the tongue.

title: Proverbs 28:24
content: 24 Whoever robs his father or his mother and says, “It’s not wrong,” is a partner with a destroyer.

title: Proverbs 28:25
content: 25 One who is greedy stirs up strife; but one who trusts in the LORD will prosper.

title: Proverbs 28:26
content: 26 One who trusts in himself is a fool; but one who walks in wisdom is kept safe.

title: Proverbs 28:27
content: 27 One who gives to the poor has no lack; but one who closes his eyes will have many curses.

title: Proverbs 28:28
content: 28 When the wicked rise, men hide themselves; but when they perish, the righteous thrive.

title: Proverbs 29:1
content: 1 He who is often rebuked and stiffens his neck will be destroyed suddenly, with no remedy.

title: Proverbs 29:2
content: 2 When the righteous thrive, the people rejoice; but when the wicked rule, the people groan.

title: Proverbs 29:3
content: 3 Whoever loves wisdom brings joy to his father; but a companion of prostitutes squanders his wealth.

title: Proverbs 29:4
content: 4 The king by justice makes the land stable, but he who takes bribes tears it down.

title: Proverbs 29:5
content: 5 A man who flatters his neighbor spreads a net for his feet.

title: Proverbs 29:6
content: 6 An evil man is snared by his sin, but the righteous can sing and be glad.

title: Proverbs 29:7
content: 7 The righteous care about justice for the poor. The wicked aren’t concerned about knowledge.

title: Proverbs 29:8
content: 8 Mockers stir up a city, but wise men turn away anger.

title: Proverbs 29:9
content: 9 If a wise man goes to court with a foolish man, the fool rages or scoffs, and there is no peace.

title: Proverbs 29:10
content: 10 The bloodthirsty hate a man of integrity; and they seek the life of the upright.

title: Proverbs 29:11
content: 11 A fool vents all of his anger, but a wise man brings himself under control.

title: Proverbs 29:12
content: 12 If a ruler listens to lies, all of his officials are wicked.

title: Proverbs 29:13
content: 13 The poor man and the oppressor have this in common: The LORD gives sight to the eyes of both.

title: Proverbs 29:14
content: 14 The king who fairly judges the poor, his throne shall be established forever.

title: Proverbs 29:15
content: 15 The rod of correction gives wisdom, but a child left to himself causes shame to his mother.

title: Proverbs 29:16
content: 16 When the wicked increase, sin increases; but the righteous will see their downfall.

title: Proverbs 29:17
content: 17 Correct your son, and he will give you peace; yes, he will bring delight to your soul.

title: Proverbs 29:18
content: 18 Where there is no revelation, the people cast off restraint; but one who keeps the law is blessed.

title: Proverbs 29:19
content: 19 A servant can’t be corrected by words. Though he understands, yet he will not respond.

title: Proverbs 29:20
content: 20 Do you see a man who is hasty in his words? There is more hope for a fool than for him.

title: Proverbs 29:21
content: 21 He who pampers his servant from youth will have him become a son in the end.

title: Proverbs 29:22
content: 22 An angry man stirs up strife, and a wrathful man abounds in sin.

title: Proverbs 29:23
content: 23 A man’s pride brings him low, but one of lowly spirit gains honor.

title: Proverbs 29:24
content: 24 Whoever is an accomplice of a thief is an enemy of his own soul. He takes an oath, but dares not testify.

title: Proverbs 29:25
content: 25 The fear of man proves to be a snare, but whoever puts his trust in the LORD is kept safe.

title: Proverbs 29:26
content: 26 Many seek the ruler’s favor, but a man’s justice comes from the LORD.

title: Proverbs 29:27
content: 27 A dishonest man detests the righteous, and the upright in their ways detest the wicked.

title: Proverbs 30:1
content: 1 The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, the revelation: the man says to Ithiel, to Ithiel and Ucal:

title: Proverbs 30:2
content: 2 “Surely I am the most ignorant man, and don’t have a man’s understanding.

title: Proverbs 30:3
content: 3 I have not learned wisdom, neither do I have the knowledge of the Holy One.

title: Proverbs 30:4
content: 4 Who has ascended up into heaven, and descended? Who has gathered the wind in his fists? Who has bound the waters in his garment? Who has established all the ends of the earth? What is his name, and what is his son’s name, if you know?

title: Proverbs 30:5
content: 5 “Every word of God is flawless. He is a shield to those who take refuge in him.

title: Proverbs 30:6
content: 6 Don’t you add to his words, lest he reprove you, and you be found a liar.

title: Proverbs 30:7
content: 7 “Two things I have asked of you. Don’t deny me before I die.

title: Proverbs 30:8
content: 8 Remove far from me falsehood and lies. Give me neither poverty nor riches. Feed me with the food that is needful for me,

title: Proverbs 30:9
content: 9 lest I be full, deny you, and say, ‘Who is the LORD?’ or lest I be poor, and steal, and so dishonor the name of my God.

title: Proverbs 30:10
content: 10 “Don’t slander a servant to his master, lest he curse you, and you be held guilty.

title: Proverbs 30:11
content: 11 There is a generation that curses their father, and doesn’t bless their mother.

title: Proverbs 30:12
content: 12 There is a generation that is pure in their own eyes, yet are not washed from their filthiness.

title: Proverbs 30:13
content: 13 There is a generation, oh how lofty are their eyes! Their eyelids are lifted up.

title: Proverbs 30:14
content: 14 There is a generation whose teeth are like swords, and their jaws like knives, to devour the poor from the earth, and the needy from among men.

title: Proverbs 30:15
content: 15 “The leech has two daughters: ‘Give, give.’ “There are three things that are never satisfied; four that don’t say, ‘Enough!’:

title: Proverbs 30:16
content: 16 Sheol, the barren womb, the earth that is not satisfied with water, and the fire that doesn’t say, ‘Enough!’

title: Proverbs 30:17
content: 17 “The eye that mocks at his father, and scorns obedience to his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, the young eagles shall eat it.

title: Proverbs 30:18
content: 18 “There are three things which are too amazing for me, four which I don’t understand:

title: Proverbs 30:19
content: 19 The way of an eagle in the air, the way of a serpent on a rock, the way of a ship in the middle of the sea, and the way of a man with a maiden.

title: Proverbs 30:20
content: 20 “So is the way of an adulterous woman: She eats and wipes her mouth, and says, ‘I have done nothing wrong.’

title: Proverbs 30:21
content: 21 “For three things the earth trembles, and under four, it can’t bear up:

title: Proverbs 30:22
content: 22 For a servant when he is king, a fool when he is filled with food,

title: Proverbs 30:23
content: 23 for an unloved woman when she is married, and a servant who is heir to her mistress.

title: Proverbs 30:24
content: 24 “There are four things which are little on the earth, but they are exceedingly wise:

title: Proverbs 30:25
content: 25 The ants are not a strong people, yet they provide their food in the summer.

title: Proverbs 30:26
content: 26 The hyraxes are but a feeble folk, yet make they their houses in the rocks.

title: Proverbs 30:27
content: 27 The locusts have no king, yet they advance in ranks.

title: Proverbs 30:28
content: 28 You can catch a lizard with your hands, yet it is in kings’ palaces.

title: Proverbs 30:29
content: 29 “There are three things which are stately in their march, four which are stately in going:

title: Proverbs 30:30
content: 30 The lion, which is mightiest among animals, and doesn’t turn away for any;

title: Proverbs 30:31
content: 31 the greyhound; the male goat; and the king against whom there is no rising up.

title: Proverbs 30:32
content: 32 “If you have done foolishly in lifting up yourself, or if you have thought evil, put your hand over your mouth.

title: Proverbs 30:33
content: 33 For as the churning of milk produces butter, and the wringing of the nose produces blood, so the forcing of wrath produces strife.”

title: Proverbs 31:1
content: 1 The words of King Lemuel—the revelation which his mother taught him:

title: Proverbs 31:2
content: 2 “Oh, my son! Oh, son of my womb! Oh, son of my vows!

title: Proverbs 31:3
content: 3 Don’t give your strength to women, nor your ways to that which destroys kings.

title: Proverbs 31:4
content: 4 It is not for kings, Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine, nor for princes to say, ‘Where is strong drink?’

title: Proverbs 31:5
content: 5 lest they drink, and forget the law, and pervert the justice due to anyone who is afflicted.

title: Proverbs 31:6
content: 6 Give strong drink to him who is ready to perish, and wine to the bitter in soul.

title: Proverbs 31:7
content: 7 Let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.

title: Proverbs 31:8
content: 8 Open your mouth for the mute, in the cause of all who are left desolate.

title: Proverbs 31:9
content: 9 Open your mouth, judge righteously, and serve justice to the poor and needy.”

title: Proverbs 31:10
content: 10 Who can find a worthy woman? For her value is far above rubies.

title: Proverbs 31:11
content: 11 The heart of her husband trusts in her. He shall have no lack of gain.

title: Proverbs 31:12
content: 12 She does him good, and not harm, all the days of her life.

title: Proverbs 31:13
content: 13 She seeks wool and flax, and works eagerly with her hands.

title: Proverbs 31:14
content: 14 She is like the merchant ships. She brings her bread from afar.

title: Proverbs 31:15
content: 15 She rises also while it is yet night, gives food to her household, and portions for her servant girls.

title: Proverbs 31:16
content: 16 She considers a field, and buys it. With the fruit of her hands, she plants a vineyard.

title: Proverbs 31:17
content: 17 She arms her waist with strength, and makes her arms strong.

title: Proverbs 31:18
content: 18 She perceives that her merchandise is profitable. Her lamp doesn’t go out by night.

title: Proverbs 31:19
content: 19 She lays her hands to the distaff, and her hands hold the spindle.

title: Proverbs 31:20
content: 20 She opens her arms to the poor; yes, she extends her hands to the needy.

title: Proverbs 31:21
content: 21 She is not afraid of the snow for her household, for all her household are clothed with scarlet.

title: Proverbs 31:22
content: 22 She makes for herself carpets of tapestry. Her clothing is fine linen and purple.

title: Proverbs 31:23
content: 23 Her husband is respected in the gates, when he sits among the elders of the land.

title: Proverbs 31:24
content: 24 She makes linen garments and sells them, and delivers sashes to the merchant.

title: Proverbs 31:25
content: 25 Strength and dignity are her clothing. She laughs at the time to come.

title: Proverbs 31:26
content: 26 She opens her mouth with wisdom. Kind instruction is on her tongue.

title: Proverbs 31:27
content: 27 She looks well to the ways of her household, and doesn’t eat the bread of idleness.

title: Proverbs 31:28
content: 28 Her children rise up and call her blessed. Her husband also praises her:

title: Proverbs 31:29
content: 29 “Many women do noble things, but you excel them all.”

title: Proverbs 31:30
content: 30 Charm is deceitful, and beauty is vain; but a woman who fears the LORD, she shall be praised.

title: Proverbs 31:31
content: 31 Give her of the fruit of her hands! Let her works praise her in the gates!
